column2: . . .[ [[Ephel Dúath]] and [[Ered Lithui]]] swung out long arms northward; and between these arms there was a deep defile.  This was Cirith Gorgor, the Haunted Pass, the entrance to the land of the [[Sauron
column3: Enemy]].  High cliffs lowered upon either side. . .
column4: ''[[The Two Towers]]'', "[[The Black Gate is Closed]]"}}

column2: description=Evil, dark pass guarded by the [[Black Gate]]

column1: '''Cirith Gorgor''' was the point where the mountain ranges of the [[Ered Lithui]] and the [[Ephel Dúath]] met, to the north-west of [[Udûn (valley)
column2: Udûn]] and [[Mordor]]. It was sealed by the Morannon ([[Black Gate]]) and guarded by the two [[Towers of the Teeth]], [[Carchost]] and [[Narchost]].<ref>{{TT

column1: It was also called the ''Haunted Pass of Cirith Gorgor'', because of the evil that lurked there.
Cirith Gorgor is [[Sindarin]] from ''[[cirith]]'' "pass" and ''[[gorgor]]'' "extreme horror".
